strings.Value: {n}'Maegar' stares at you without blinking, his face like stone.{/n} "You've kept me waiting. In so doing, you disrespect me. And…" {n}Vordakai gives a disgusted hiss.{/n} "I can feel this flesh slowly dying even as I wait."
{n}Vordakai's eyes snap open.{/n} "So you decided to set them free." {n}He frowns.{/n} "Wasteful — your kind breeds quickly, their numbers would have been restored in short order."
{n}Vordakai's eyes slowly open.{/n} "So you've decided to keep the jars for your own needs." {n}He nods.{/n} "Wise. My work on capturing these souls is far more valuable than the lives within."

"I shall be your honored guest." {n}Vordakai's face twists — in what might be a grin, but you're not sure.{/n} "There, I will study your habits, your books, absorb all I need... but do not fear, you and your barony shall remain untouched." {n}He stares at you for a moment.{/n} "For now. And also, for now... farewell."

"Foul. I'd forgotten how skin... feels." {n}He shakes his head, like a dog trying to throw off a collar.{/n} "But the reason I wait... in the time between then and now, what did you decide to do..." {n}He closes his eyes, as though listening to the sounds in the tomb... or to something else.{/n} "Those souls... Where are they...?"

"As for me, I shall assume the role of this..." {n}He raises his hands, and his face curls with contempt.{/n} "...this '{d|Varn}Maegar{/d},' the upstart ruler of {g|Varnhold}Varnhold{/g}." {n}He turns to lock eyes with you, and his voice grows colder, sharper.{/n} "But know that my ambition is greater than one settlement — I'll be with you, in your citadel, as befits my station."
